messages.content: ComfyUI-PixelArt-Detector is a custom node in ComfyUI that allows generating, downscaling, changing palettes, and restoring pixel art images using SDXL.
How many custom nodes does ComfyUI-PixelArt-Detector add?
ComfyUI-PixelArt-Detector adds 4 custom nodes: PixelArt Detector (+Save), PixelArt Detector (Image->), PixelArt Palette Converter, and PixelArt Palette Loader.
What is the purpose of the PixelArt Detector (+Save) node?
The PixelArt Detector (+Save) node is an all-in-one node that reduces palette, resizes, and saves images.
What is the purpose of the PixelArt Palette Converter node?
The PixelArt Palette Converter node changes the palette of the input image. It has several embedded palettes and can be used with the PixelArt Palette Loader for more options.
What is the purpose of the PixelArt Palette Loader node?
The PixelArt Palette Loader node comes with many custom palettes that can be input to the PixelArt Palette Converter's 'paletteList' input. It also has an optional GRIDS preview of all palettes.
To install ComfyUI-PixelArt-Detector, users need to open a terminal in ComfyUI/custom_nodes/ and run the command: git clone https://github.com/dimtoneff/ComfyUI-PixelArt-Detector
What is the recommended LoRa to use with ComfyUI-PixelArt-Detector?
The recommended LoRa to use with ComfyUI-PixelArt-Detector is Pixel Art XL, which can be found at https://civitai.com/models/120096/pixel-art-xl
What are the recommended positive and negative prompts for text2image in ComfyUI-PixelArt-Detector?

Recommended positive prompt: pixelart, {your scene}, pixel-art. low-res, blocky, pixel art style, 8-bit graphics, sharp details, less colors, early computer game art. Recommended negative prompt: sloppy, messy, blurry, noisy, highly detailed, ultra textured, photo, realistic, high-resolution, photo-realistic.
What are the sources of the included palettes in ComfyUI-PixelArt-Detector?
The included palettes in ComfyUI-PixelArt-Detector are sourced from https://lospec.com/palette-list.
